content: this pattern is dedicated to the memory of werner silber my husband s grandfather as a child he and his family fled nazi germany into china and eventually to america werner was a vastly talented intelligent man who spoke 7 languages and had a beautiful singing voice i m happy to make this pattern free in his memory this pattern is for your personal use and the contents are my original work do not share any portions of this pattern in any form for others to use you are 100% free to sell any physical items made with this pattern please tag me @womanwalkingawire in any social media posts of items made with this pattern or link the pattern all my social and shop links can be found here linktr ee/womanwalkingawire message me with any questions at any time of day i usually respond within 24 hours if you are having trouble and want to reach out to me for help send pics enjoy i look forward to seeing what you ve created with this pattern abbreviations-us terms materials magic_ring- magic_ring 4mm crochet hook sm- stitch marker 12 stitch markers slip_stitch- slip_stitch worsted weight size 4 yarn chain- chain min 2 colors chsp- chain space yarn needle single_crochet- single_crochet scissors half_double_crochet- half_double_crochet double_crochet- double_crochet treble_crochet-treble_crochet ij- invisible join fo- fasten_off ©2024 christine anne melvin/womanwalkingawire 1 notes when a round starts with a new color i use standing stitches this is why you won t see me instructing you to start with chains you can start with a chain of equivalent height if you prefer half_double_crochet=ch2 double_crochet=ch3 edc/treble_crochet=ch4 but i think the standing stitch looks best see recommended resources for videos on how to make standing stitches chains between stitches do not count in the stitch count of a round unless otherwise directed or noted they are chain spaces chsps why do i tell you slip_stitch or ij invisible join at the end of some rounds it s my personal preference to make an invisible join when i fasten_off fo because i think it looks cleaner you can choose to do whichever method you prefer see recommended resources for videos on how to make an invisible join the square may require blocking if you do block do it gently and lightly or the center will become distorted these granny squares come out to approximately 5 ½ x 5 ½ inches but will vary in size depending on materials used link to video tutorial youtube link to seal of solomon video tutorial recommended resources youtube links for invisible join & standing stitches by crystals and crochet ©2024 christine anne melvin/womanwalkingawire 2 round 1 - with background color round 2 12 double_crochet into magic_ring chain 3 counts as 1st double_crochet & double_crochet into same st close ring tightly and slip_stitch to 1st st to join 2 double_crochet into each st around do not fo 12sts slip_stitch to 1st st to join do not fo 24 sts round 3 round 4 chain 3 counts
